titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Ms. Codex 742: Sermones dominicales per circulum anni

availability.licence: These images and the content of Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts Ms. Codex 742: Sermones dominicales per circulum anni are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Collection of anonymous sermons for Sundays from the Second Sunday of Advent through the 25th Sunday after Pentecost.

supportDesc.extent: 65 leaves : 200 x 139 (150 x 113) mm. bound to 207 x 154 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Parchment, i (modern paper) + 65 + i (modern paper); i-lx, [61-65]; i-lx in roman numerals in a near contemporary hand, upper center recto; modern foliation in pencil, upper right recto.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in 2 columns of 30 lines (f. 1-60) and 39 lines (f. 61-65); ruled in lead; some prickings visible on last few leaves.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in a Gothic book script by several hands; text is continued in a later [possibly early 14th-century?] hand (f. 61v-65v), with headings added in a slightly later hand and marginal notes in several hands; includes a number of pointing fingers or hands, some humorous.

decoDesc.decoNote: Red and blue used for rubrication, 2-line red and blue initials with penwork ornamentation (f. 1-60).

origin.p: Written in France[?] in the 13th century (Zacour-Hirsch).
